# Aether Framework

> A Django-like Kotlin Multiplatform framework for JVM (Vert.x + Virtual Threads) and Wasm (Cloudflare/Browser).

## Overview

Aether is a "colorless" framework that abstracts platform differences via expect/actual declarations, enabling write-once-deploy-anywhere web applications.

## Key Features

- **Multiplatform**: JVM, WasmJS (Browser/Cloudflare Workers), WasmWASI
- **Virtual Threads**: Java 21 Loom for high-performance concurrent handling
- **Type-Safe Routing**: Radix tree router with O(k) path matching
- **Active Record ORM**: Django-inspired models with QueryAST (not string SQL)
- **Middleware Pipeline**: Composable request/response processing
- **SSR + Hydration**: Server-side rendering with CBOR serialization
- **Authentication**: Basic, Bearer, JWT, API Key, Form providers
- **WebSocket Support**: Full-duplex with pub/sub channels
- **gRPC Support**: DSL, adapters, and code-first proto generation

## Modules

| Module | Purpose |
|--------|---------|
| aether-core | Exchange, Pipeline, Dispatcher foundation |
| aether-web | Radix tree router, path parameters |
| aether-db | ORM, QueryAST, database drivers |
| aether-auth | Authentication providers |
| aether-ui | Composable UI DSL, SSR |
| aether-grpc | gRPC with DSL and proto generation |
| aether-channels | WebSocket pub/sub groups |
| aether-tasks | Background job queue with KSP |
| aether-signals | Event system (preSave, postSave) |
| aether-forms | Form handling and validation |
| aether-admin | Admin panel generation |
| aether-net | Transport abstraction |
| aether-ksp | Migration generation |
| aether-cli | Command-line tools |
| aether-plugin | Gradle plugin |

## Database Drivers

- **PostgreSQL** (JVM): Vert.x Reactive Client
- **Supabase**: PostgREST API (JVM + Wasm)
- **Firestore**: REST API (JVM + Wasm, NoSQL)

## Quick Example

```kotlin
val router = router {
    get("/users/:id") { exchange ->
        val id = exchange.pathParamInt("id")
        exchange.respondJson(User.findById(id))
    }
}

val pipeline = pipeline {
    installRecovery()
    installCallLogging()
    use(router.asMiddleware())
}

AetherServer.start(port = 8080, pipeline = pipeline)
```
